1.name: The Sound of Music
1.description: A woman leaves an Austrian convent to become a governess to the children of a Naval officer widower.

2.name: Per qualche dollaro in più
2.description: Two bounty hunters with the same intentions team up to track down a Western outlaw.

3.name: Doctor Zhivago
3.description: The life of a Russian physician and poet who, although married to another, falls in love with a political activist's wife and experiences hardship during World War I and then the October Revolution.

4.name: Thunderball
4.description: James Bond heads to the Bahamas to recover two nuclear warheads stolen by S.P.E.C.T.R.E. Agent Emilio Largo in an international extortion scheme.

5.name: The Sons of Katie Elder
5.description: Ranch owner Katie Elder's four sons determine to avenge the murder of their father and the swindling of their mother.

6.name: The Great Race
6.description: In the early 20th century, two rivals, the heroic Leslie and the despicable Professor Fate, engage in an epic automobile race from New York to Paris.

7.name: Beach Blanket Bingo
7.description: In the fourth of the highly successful Frankie and Annette beach party movies, a motorcycle gang led by Eric Von Zipper kidnaps singing star Sugar Kane managed by Bullets, who hires ...                See full summary »

8.name: Repulsion
8.description: A sex-repulsed woman who disapproves of her sister's boyfriend sinks into depression and has horrific visions of rape and violence.

9.name: Faster, Pussycat! Kill! Kill!
9.description: Three go-go dancers holding a young girl hostage come across a crippled old man living with his two sons in the desert. After learning he's hiding a sum of cash around, the women start scheming on him.

10.name: Cat Ballou
10.description: A young schoolteacher turns into an outlaw to avenge her murdered father.

11.name: In Harm's Way
11.description: A Naval officer, reprimanded after Pearl Harbor, is later promoted to Rear Admiral and gets a second chance to prove himself against the Japanese.

12.name: The Beach Girls and the Monster
12.description: Surfers are being brutally murdered. Is the culprit a sea monster or just one of the teens' jealous parents?

13.name: Battle of the Bulge
13.description: A dramatization of Nazi Germany's final Western Front counterattack of World War II.

14.name: Dear Brigitte
14.description: Professor Leaf, an absent-minded poet with a prejudice against the sciences, is forced to face the fact that his son is a math prodigy with little artistic talent of his own.

15.name: The Hill
15.description: In a North African military prison during World War II, five new prisoners struggle to survive in the face of brutal punishment and sadistic guards.

16.name: Help!
16.description: Ringo Starr finds himself the human sacrifice target of a cult, and his fellow members of The Beatles must try to protect him from it.

17.name: The Greatest Story Ever Told
17.description: An all-star, large scale epic film that chronicles the life and ministry of Jesus Christ.

18.name: Pierrot le fou
18.description: Pierrot escapes his boring society and travels from Paris to the Mediterranean Sea with Marianne, a girl chased by hit-men from Algeria. They lead an unorthodox life, always on the run.

19.name: The Collector
19.description: A man kidnaps a woman and holds her hostage just for the pleasure of having her there.

20.name: Dr. Goldfoot and the Bikini Machine
20.description: Skirt-chasing SIC agent Craig Gamble and millionaire bachelor Todd Armstrong set out to foil mad scientist Dr. Goldfoot's plot to use his army of bikini-clad robots to seduce wealthy men into signing over their assets.

21.name: The Flight of the Phoenix
21.description: After a plane crash in the Sahara, one of the survivors says he's an airplane designer and they can make a flyable plane from the wreckage.

22.name: How to Stuff a Wild Bikini
22.description: Frankie, on naval-reserve duty in Tahiti, doesn't trust Dee Dee to stay faithful, so he hires Bwana, a witch doctor, to help. Bwana conjures up a floating bikini, "stuffs" it with Cassandra...                See full summary »

23.name: Othello
23.description: A General's marriage is destroyed when a vengeful Lieutenant convinces him that his new wife has been unfaithful.

24.name: She
24.description: An Edwardian archaeologist and two companions stumble upon a lost city in East Africa, run by a beautiful queen whose love holds the promise of immortality.

25.name: Invasion
25.description: An alien spaceship crashes near a rural hospital. When the alien is taken to the hospital, a mysterious force field suddenly appears around it.

26.name: That Darn Cat!
26.description: After a kidnapped bank teller uses a neighbor's wandering cat to send an SOS, the FBI assigns a cat-allergic agent to the case.

27.name: Alphaville, une étrange aventure de Lemmy Caution
27.description: A U.S. secret agent is sent to the distant space city of Alphaville where he must find a missing person and free the city from its tyrannical ruler.

28.name: Shenandoah
28.description: During the Civil War, a Virginia farmer and his family vow to remain neutral, but one of the sons is captured by Union soldiers, sending the farmer to his rescue.

29.name: The Spy Who Came In from the Cold
29.description: British agent Alec Leamas refuses to come in from the Cold War during the 1960s, choosing to face another mission, which may prove to be his final one.

30.name: Those Magnificent Men in Their Flying Machines or How I Flew from London to Paris in 25 hours 11 minutes
30.description: Hoping to push Britain to the forefront of aviation, a London publisher organizes an international air race across the English Channel, but must contend with two entrants vying for his daughter, as well as national rivalries and cheating.

31.name: Village of the Giants
31.description: Delinquent teen-agers ingest a substance and grow thirty feet tall, then proceed to take over a small town.

32.name: The Cincinnati Kid
32.description: An up-and-coming poker player tries to prove himself in a high-stakes match against a long-time master of the game.

33.name: What's New Pussycat
33.description: A playboy who refuses to give up his hedonistic lifestyle to settle down and marry his true love seeks help from a demented psychoanalyst who is having romantic problems of his own.

34.name: Kaijû daisensô
34.description: Aliens from Planet X request the use of Godzilla and Rodan to fight off King Ghidorah, but have a better use for the three monsters.

35.name: Orgy of the Dead
35.description: Bob and his girlfriend Shirley go in search of a cemetery in order to inspire John for writing his next horror story. After they crash the car, they wander into the graveyard and encounter ...                See full summary »

36.name: Darling
36.description: Beautiful, but amoral, model Diana Scott (Julie Christie) sleeps her way to the top of the London fashion scene at the height of the Swinging Sixties.

37.name: The Ipcress File
37.description: In London, a counter espionage Agent deals with his own bureaucracy while investigating the kidnapping and brainwashing of British scientists.

38.name: Major Dundee
38.description: In 1864, due to frequent Apache raids from Mexico into the U.S., a Union officer decides to illegally cross the border and destroy the Apache, using a mixed army of Union troops, Confederate POWs, civilian mercenaries, and scouts.

39.name: The Party's Over
39.description: An American businessman visits London and is horrified to discover his nubile teenage daughter has become involved with a gang of thuggish "beatniks". Her involvement leads to wild parties, sex, death and necrophilia.

40.name: A Patch of Blue
40.description: A blind, uneducated white girl is befriended by a black man, who becomes determined to help her escape her impoverished and abusive home life by introducing her to the outside world.

41.name: Campanadas a medianoche
41.description: The career of Shakespeare's Sir John Falstaff as a roistering companion to young Prince Hal, circa 1400 to 1413.

42.name: The Naked Prey
42.description: During the 1800s, a safari guide, two elephant hunters and their crew run into trouble with the natives in the South African veld when they refuse to offer gifts to the tribesmen.

43.name: Le bonheur
43.description: François, a young carpenter, lives a happy, uncomplicated life with his wife Thérèse and their two small children. One day he meets Emilie, a clerk in the local post office.

44.name: Ship of Fools
44.description: A varied group of passengers boarding a ship bound for pre-WWII Germany represents a microcosm of early 1930s society.

45.name: The Glory Guys
45.description: What could be worse for two cavalry officers than to battle with native tribes? To battle each other for the same woman.

46.name: Dr. Terror's House of Horrors
46.description: Aboard a British train, mysterious fortune teller Dr. Schreck uses tarot cards to read the futures of five fellow passengers.

47.name: Akahige
47.description: In 19th century Japan, a rough tempered yet charitable town doctor trains a young intern.

48.name: How to Murder Your Wife
48.description: A dedicated bachelor drunkenly marries a young woman and immediately lives to regret it.

49.name: The Bedford Incident
49.description: An American destroyer Captain is determined to confront a Soviet submarine caught violating territorial waters. Perhaps too determined.

50.name: The Heroes of Telemark
50.description: Norwegian resistance tries to stop German efforts to produce an atomic bomb component during World War II.
